column5: This is the first lake i tried called twin lakes i renamed it as skunk lake lol   okangon lake        dinner  caught this trout in the hardest place of all a stocked pond lol at the wifes uncles ranch       found big foot!     It was a pretty good trip but next time i go out there ill be doing some river salmon fishing or sturgeon

Nice report & scenery pics for sure !!! too bad about that skunk  lake,   :huh:that okanogan area sure is nice,ive been all through the area and did some fishing for bull trout,and almost had the same luck,just a few small ones!!, better luck next time,but hey you did get a nice trout,even if it was stocked!!!..LOL..LOL.

Wow, can't beat that scenery. Nice trout too. I just read two women in B.C. reported seeing bigfoot while picking blueberries. Maybe it was mushrooms they were picking. That would explain the bigfoot sighting
looks like a cool trip, thanks for sharing.
Good job sleded  Very nice pics..... awesome scenery  Thanks for sharing Leechman
Beautiful pics I must say I have seen the okangon Valley very nice place
I third the Okanagan! Great to hear from you again sleded!  Great report.  I have lots of lakes that are called skunk lake as well....LOL

I expect to be fishing just south of there this weekend in Vaseux Lake for largemouth/smallmouth and just southeast of there next Mon-Tues. in the Colmbia River for walleye- smallmouth. The rainbow photos looked like a pair of nice chunky fish.  outdoorguy61
loved all the pics!!....nice rainbow for a pond
Looked like a good trip Eric, thanks for the pictures...
Awsome pictures!   Next time you head out there, you be sure to give me a call and i will go!  I cant wait to get out there.  Thanks for the pictures
Stunning Pictures, especially like the one on the mountain top through the clouds!! Very cool, thanks for the report.  Cheers, 1leg
Sleded walking outside in his underwear = sasquatch sighting IMO  Nice pics duuuuuude let's go bass fishing now that you're in the sportsman's paradise again!
Great pics Eric, Good to see you and the mrs had a good trip.  Gotta love BC.  It really is beautiful country.
